name: Professional Practice
description: Students explore the requirements of establishing a career as a practicing visual artist. Topics covered include portfolio development, finding and securing artist residency and exhibition opportunities, ways to support yourself as an artist, grant writing, photo documentation, peer group support, marketing and bookkeeping. [24S, 12P] For Art History majors/specialists: 1.0 credits in FAH at the 300/400 level, Permission of the Department.
prerequisites: For Art and Art History majors/specialists: 4.0 FAS courses and 1.5 FAH/VCC credits, Permission of the Department.
